Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= action by which humans speaks softly for themselves as if thinking out load
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= action by which humans watch and wait attentively and anxiously for something to happen
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
literally: to take position; hence: = action by which humans stand firm without fear in the face of danger

= action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which something that has been said is not truthful
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= person with whom one is in conflict
literally: to make someone else's way straight; = causative action by which deities cause the actions and endeavors of humans to be prosperous and successful
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: to be established; hence: = state in which information can be trusted
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable

= the passage which leads from the back of the mouth of humans in the direction of the the lungs; ► internally, it functions as a passage way for food and breath; externally, it is a place around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ associated with food and speaking
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

Node.gloss: to cause to flatter|to make deceitful
Node.definition: literally: to make smooth; hence: = causative action by which humans cause events to appear well intentioned, though actually being insincere

Node.gloss: to make someone bear his/her guilt|to punish
Node.definition: = to make someone bear the consequences for an unlawful deed for which one is held responsible
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status
= action by which humans exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

Node.gloss: to drive out|to cast out|to disperse
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to leave their place or position using force
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a large, long, oblong object, about the height of a man, made of wood, metal, leather stretched over wood, or even plaited strips of wood or reeds, and used to protect the entire body against the weapons of the opponent; certain officers made use of shield bearers to carry it for them when they were not using it
= action by which humans or deities place themselves around other humans or groups of people; ► either to attack or to protect
